description:
We're looking for a QA Engineer to join the Global-e Core R&D department and take a significant part in the delivery of Global-e's core system.
We’re looking for someone who's passionate about technology and software testing, with end-to-end experience in testing web applications in a complex, cloud-based environment.
The core group is responsible for the most important components of the system providing a multi-tenant, fully customizable checkout experience; APIs for e-commerce platforms integration; end-to-end payments solutions that involve third-party integration in a secured payment environment.
Requirements:

At least 3 years of proven experience in manual testing web applications
Proven experience with writing and executing STP / STD / STR
Proven experience in writing SQL queries (MSSQL)
Exceptional interpersonal skills
Strong ability to deep dive into the problem and find the root cause
Previous experience with e-commerce systems - strong advantage
Experience with Postman -advantage
B.Sc. in Computer Science or other technical fields – advantage
Experience working in SCRUM methodologies – strong advantage
Global-e is an equal opportunity employer. Our team is made up of people from a wide variety of backgrounds and lifestyles. We embrace diversity and welcome applications from people of all walks of life. Our people play the key role in our success, and we are always looking for more driven, talented, and ambitious individuals to join our growing international family.Report

We are looking for motivated and talented people to join our team. If you are looking for a challenging position in a fast-paced start-up environment, please send your CV to us at careers@bufferzonesecurity.com.
BUFFERZONE’s QA team is responsible for verifying that all product releases meet the highest standards. As a member of the QA team, the QA engineer will be responsible for planning, writing and executing product test plans, both manual and automatic. The job requires a good understanding of the MS Windows environment, Windows applications, client-server systems, and security applications.

Responsibilities
Planning test cycles according to Product Requirements, Design Documents and work plans
Writing detailed and creative manual and automated test plans
Creating and executing tests
Providing technical support for the product when needed, mostly in English

Requirements
Excellent English – spoken and written
Self-motivated and independent learner
Team-oriented, methodical and organized
Energetic and willing to work in a fast paced environment
Prior experience with Active Directory, networks, file sharing systems, security software
2-3 years experience in QA – an advantage
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent technical field experience – an advantage
Prior experience with JIRA – an advantageShow more Report

ironSource Aura, a revolutionary large-scale mobile platform, is looking for a great QA Engineer to join a new emerging team that will be working on our main product. Our team uses the latest and greatest technologies to build scalable products which reach and influence millions of users around the world. The team’s technological stack includes Web, Android, Frontend, Backend, Data and more.
We value team players with technical excellence and a sense of ownership who know how to choose the right tool for the right task.
Requirements:

1-2 years of experience in manual mobile QA
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience in writing QA test plans
Ability to multitask and work on multiple technical areas simultaneously
A great team player, who loves to be part of a technical team
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, fluent written and verbal English

Role:

Join a top-notch engineering team and work on disruptive products
Assure that our millions of users around the world will receive state of the art products
Work with product and engineering to define testing plans and scope
Perform functional testing for new features, regression testing, and track defects
Business Unit:

R&D

Advantages:

B.Sc in CS/Engineering/Mathematics/Physics or equivalent
Experience with testing tools such as adb, fiddler and logcat
Experience in mobile testing
Experience with SQL
Experience with writing test plan
Experience with Android studio + adb commandsShow more Report

We are looking for a QA Engineer to join our team.
For this position, you'll need to have great technical skills, prior experience testing consumer products, and a comprehensive understanding of QA workflow and technology in general.
You should have a keen eye for detail and excellent communication skills. If you are also adept at executing test cases manually and are passionate about quality - we'd like to meet you.
Requirements:

At least 1 year experience working as a QA engineer with consumer-based productsExperience in running manual tests on web and mobile applicationsLove of process, documentation, and methodologyStrong interpersonal, relationship management, and facilitation skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skills in EnglishAbility to drill down into the smallest of details while guarding the true essence of the productShow more Report

Unleash is powering the productivity revolution by providing users with a centralized way to search through their cloud based apps and local desktop. A light weight search interface allows users to enter their search query and receive relevant ranked results which are yielded in seconds.

As a user centric company, we place a great deal of emphasis on users experience when building our product and have fun doing it!
﻿
We are a fresh and energetic startup, post round A in funding ($12M), led by a strong team of second timer founders and top angel investors and VCs from the Sillicon Valley and Tel Aviv. Our expanding team is made up of enthusiastic and dedicated members working together to revolutionize the productivity world. We believe that collaboration across teams - where everyone is accessible, from our newest hires to the founders - combined with a vested interest in our teams well being are the keys to our successful working environment.
﻿We are looking for a Junior QA Engineer to join our R&D team and continue growing our product!

Your main responsibilities will include:

Planning and execution of tests on both Front and Backend sides as well as integrations with external services
Executing hands-on manual tests of the companies products on different OS
Use a variety of tools for debugging and executing tests
Reporting and tracking issues (bugs and tasks)
Working collaboratively with other team members from the Product and Development teams
Report to QA Team lead
Requirements and Qualifications:

Graduate of a software testing course or a relevant academic degree
At least 1 year of experience as a manual software tester
Understanding of client/server model
Experience working with Linux & Mac
Good inter-personal skills
If you are a bright, pro-active, ambitious and naturally curious person who shares our value of teamwork, and you hold these skills, send us your CV!Report

Via is using technology to transform transportation around the world. From changing a single person's daily commute to reducing humanity's collective environmental footprint — we've got huge goals.

As a QA Engineer, at Via, you will be a part of the end-to-end quality assurance team, working in close collaboration with our product and development teams on new product launches. in this role you will act as the critical link between technical teams and implementation with our partners. You'll be a powerful part of Via's testing service, making sure we deliver reliable and delightful products.

What You'll Do:

Build and run organized processes of manual QA testing
Develop and execute test plans covering sanity, functional, regression, and performance tests in an end-to-end environment
Investigate, identify and report bugs discovered in our flows
Validate and test a wide variety of technologies and platforms
Create documentation, implement new QA processes and improve existing ones
Verify that real-world use cases and user expectations are simulated and met during the validation process

Who You Are:

1- 3 years experience working as a QA engineer with consumer-based products
You have experience in running manual tests on web and mobile applications
You have a love of process, methodology, and documentation - specifically in writing test documents like STD, STP, STR
Ability to work across multiple new projects simultaneously - you're organized, independent, and eager to learn
You're a team player with strong interpersonal, communication, and relationship management skills
Ability to drill down into the smallest of details while guarding the true essence of the product - you are passionate about the end user experience
Experience in a fast-paced environment with a rapidly growing product


We're Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. We pioneered the TransitTech category to ensure that the future of transportation is shared, dynamic public mobility — the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, minimizes reliance on private cars, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around.

With the addition of Remix into our portfolio, we created the first end-to-end TransitTech solution for cities and transit agencies, offering world-class software, service design, and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves.


We're committed to building and nurturing a team as diverse as the communities we serve. Bringing transportation equity to the world begins with championing equal opportunity in our own offices. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated here.

Ready to join the ride?

Via is an equal opportunity employeReport

vFunction is the first and only AI-driven platform for architects and developers that intelligently and automatically transforms complex monolithic applications into microservices, restoring engineering velocity and optimizing the benefits of the cloud. Designed to eliminate the time, risk, and cost constraints of manually modernizing business applications, vFunction delivers a scalable, repeatable factory model purpose-built for cloud native modernization.
With vFunction, leading companies around the world are accelerating the journey to cloud-native architecture and gaining a competitive edge.
We are a first-of-a-kind, cloud-native modernization platform that uses dynamic analysis, static analysis, data science, and automation to enable organizations to transform 100s of Java monolithic applications a year into microservices and provide continuous modernization.
Job Description:
We are looking for a Manual Quality Engineer to join our team, to help us test and improve our product.
As part of the role, you will work closely with the R&D team and our PM. Your role includes testing API, creating, executing, and maintaining automated UI tests, and investigating test results on daily basis. We expect you to raise issues, flag problems, find bugs and errors, work professionally with R&D teams, and help troubleshoot issues. You will proactively bring new ideas and promote innovation, design test strategies, and test plans and document technical issues.
Requirements:
3+ years of proven experience as a Quality Engineer
Experience in UI and REST API testing.
Strong knowledge of Unix/Linux OS, SQL, and Networking.
Ability to handle complex technical environments and troubleshooting.
Ability to write technical documents.
Ability to work independently and in a team.
Be organized and detail oriented.
Good verbal and writing in Hebrew and English (A Must)
Preferred Skills:
Experience testing in a Java code environment.
Experience working with public clouds.
Knowledge of JVM tuning and profiling.
Knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, or other containerization platforms.

Please contact us with questions or to apply.Show more Report

At aiOla, we live by our mission - to bridge the gaps between Human Intelligence and Artificial Intelligence while connecting the “AI promise” for the masses. aiOla provides you with real-time, natural language ontology-driven, user-friendly, multi-sourced business insights, and intelligence on the go. With vital intelligence at their fingertips and fast access to everything they need to know when they need to know it, your frontline employees are supercharged for success.
Our growing team of Product, Data Science, Data Engineering, Analytics, and Customer Success professionals in Israel and in the US is composed of passionate, bright minds and uncompromising ambition, boasting hundreds of years of collective experience!
aiOla's unique culture is shaped by its people - with exceptional individuals, eager to learn from one another and create extraordinary solutions. Surround yourself with visionaries and creators, enthusiastic about generating a real impact on everything they do, and you will never cease to learn and grow. Join Us in Pushing the Limits of Human Intelligence!
Responsibilities:
Take responsibility from the spec phase to post-production support
Create detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases.
Take an active role in version testing and pre-release processes
Plan, analyze, design and execute manual and automated e2e tests of new and legacy features
Create new automated tests
Investigate customer issues
Be a part of agile team
Work closely with other QA engineers, developers, product and architects.



Requirements:

BSc in Computer Science.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Attention to detail, self-learner, with good communication skills
Strong knowledge of QA Documentation and methodologies - Advantage
Previous Experience writing automated tests - Advantage
Experience in TS/JS programming languages - AdvantageReport

Viber is one of the most popular apps in the world, and the most downloaded app to have come out of the start-up nation. Working with Viber is a unique opportunity to influence the hundreds of millions of people using our messaging app.

The QA Team at Viber tests innovative features and products at the user level, both manually and with automated tools. We work with development engineers to understand technical implementations and with the product team to define the desired user experience.

As a QA Engineer at Viber you will be responsible for understanding the domain and the product in detail, coming up with the test strategy, planning, and test cases, all while focusing on delivering the best possible user experience.
This position is a temp position for 9 months

Responsibilities
Review product and technical documentation to ensure the requirements that meet the goal are unambiguous and verifiable
Plan and execute test plans, test cases, and produce test reports
Push for and strive to resolve issues without compromising quality
Maintain effective communication between all project members at all testing stages to ensure all information regarding product quality has surfaced
Working with automation tools – writing test cases and monitoring results
Requirements
2+ years of QA experience
Test planning and design (STP, STD, and STR) experience
Deep understanding of QA processes and test methodologies
Mobile testing experience
Applications testing experience
English proficiency – both speaking and writing
Strong technical background
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Advantages
Automation tools/test writing experience
Basic knowledge in coding/scripting in any language
Academic degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field
ISTQB course/certification
Ability to understand client and server logsShow more Report

Rivery’s SaaS platform provides a fully-managed solution for data ingestion, data transformation, data orchestration, reverse ETL and more with built-in support for your data operations development and deployment lifecycles.
Rivery’s data solutions are used by some of the world’s biggest brands, enterprises, and startups in over 20 countries. Our platform helps data professionals, CIOs, BI analysts, and marketing experts solve complex data challenges. As our company grows, we are looking for the brightest minds across multiple disciplines to join our teams in the US, UK, and Israel.
We are looking for a QA Engineer to join our growing R&D department.
As part of your role in Rivery you will work closely with all R&D engineers, helping them test their developments, define DODs and improve the stability and quality of our service.

In this role you will:

Design, develop and execute test scenarios for our service
Write test documents such as STP, STD, STR
Use different testing techniques such as system, integration & API, UI testing
Required skills:

3 + years of experience as a manual QA engineer
Experience with UI and API testing
Knowledge in various DBs such as MongoDB, MySQL, Postgres etc.
Ability to self-learning and a passion for discovering & learning new things
High attention to details
Strong knowledge in QA processes and methodologies (experience in writing and executing STP, STD, STR)
Familiarity with formal testing tools like swagger, postman, wire mocks etc.
Advantages:

Python knowledge
Willingness to expand to automated testsShow more Report

We're looking for an experienced QA Engineer who is passionate about technology and inspired by great UX.

You'll be instrumental in bringing features to the finish line while collaborating closely with developers, as well as with the Product, Data, and Machine Learning teams—all with the goal of delivering a seamless, joyful experience for our customers.

In this role you'll
Analyze user stories to identify test cases, ensuring an appropriate mix of manual and automated test coverage
Mentor others and promote effective quality assurance strategies and best practices
Use data to assess the quality and identify improvement tasks that should be prioritized
Provide an assessment of delivery readiness and collaborate with other teams to ensure timely release
Help maintain our outstanding customer experience by having a diligent eye for UI details
What you'll need
4+ years experience as a QA engineer
Hands-on experience running manual tests on multiple platforms for user-facing products
Ability to create beautifully written test plans, define testing strategies, and document knowledge
Experience in coaching and mentoring junior QA engineers
Superior analytical skills, with a problem-solving attitude
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Experience with Postman and API requests
Experience with UI or API automation tools (Cypress, Testim, Loadmill, etc.) is a major advantage
Ability to work in an office environmentShow more Report

We are looking for a talented QA Engineer to join our Engineering team and help build the company’s cloud cybersecurity solution for the automotive industry. This role is full-time and is Herzliya Israel based. Responsibilities Interface daily with our R&D teams to identify and resolve problems found during testing Work in close cooperation with product management architects and developers Deeply understand the business and technical requirements of existing and new products Work according to high execution standards, while adhering to project goals and ensuring high quality Create and execute manual Tests 3+ years experience as a QA Engineer Experience with database products such as PSQL - a must Proven experience in functional, regression, and integration testing Ability to write clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans Ability to research and resolve technical issues Highly organized and able to consistently deliver excellent quality on a timely manner Self-directed, flexible, and adaptable Excellent English communication capabilities (verbal and writing) Strong team player Knowledge and previous experience working with cloud platforms (primarily Azure and AWS) Practical knowledge of application security and vulnerabilities - an advantage Experience with Selenium-based tools - an advantageShow more Report

We are:

Zotapay is a payment gateway technology hub, serving as a one-stop-shop for online businesses, enabling them to accept payments from anyone, anywhere. We are connected to over 1000 financial institutions worldwide, allowing us to centralize a range of global and local payment methods, on one payment page.

About the opportunity:

The Integration Team is looking for an Integration Engineer with a passion for managing integration projects and cooperating with different parties. Your mission will be to complete payment gateway integration project with our providers.
What you will do:

Keep engagement up with a high-speed development process and ongoing deliveries - executing and adjusting your project plans accordingly
Manual QA and verification of integrations and workflow
Work closely with the development team and gateway providers to deliver new products
Report bugs and work out the solutions
Provide information on the completed integration to the operation team
Assist on side-tasks related to product improvement
Requirements:

At least 1 year of tech project management or manual QA experience
Knowledge of tools, concepts, and methodologies of QA – nice to have
Familiarity with REST API documentation, Postman, JSON, Browser stack
Passion for troubleshooting and constant self-learning
Ability to quickly learn new features and adapt to innovations
Sharp attention to detail
Fluent in spoken and written English
Great team player with the ability to work with minimal supervision
Specific skills
What happens after you apply?

Our HR team is invested in creating the best candidate experience possible, so we will be in touch, once we have reviewed your CV, regarding any next steps.

In the meantime, you can check out our website and social media pages to learn more about us.Show more Report

About The Position
About Us:
CodeValue, founded in 2010, is a leading dynamic software development and consulting services company.
We deliver tailor-made innovative solutions and services ranging from focused product and technology analysis, to comprehensive development and in-depth consultancy.
Our solutions address varied needs across every domain, from startups and mid-size firms, government agencies, public and private enterprises, and global corporations.
Technology is at the heart of everything we do. We consider ourselves lucky since we are able to turn our hobby into a prosperous career. Being a dynamic software development and consulting company means we never stop learning, evolving… Growing. Join us and always be one-step ahead!
Requirements
We're looking for responsible, hardworking, willing to work in a dynamic and demanding environment, Independent, fast learner, motivated team player.
Skills:
At least 3 years of hands-on experience in a similar role.
Testing experience with event driven and microservices architecture.
Experience with API testing.
Strong knowledge in QA processes and methodologies (experience in test planning, test design, test strategy, and test execution).
Strong analytical abilities and troubleshooting skills.
Ability to quickly learn new concepts and software.
A responsible and dedicated worker, willing to work in a dynamic and demanding environment.
Motivated team player who helps drive the team forward.
Familiarity with formal testing tools like swagger, postman, wire mocks etc.
Not a must but a great advantage
Good knowledge and Experience in SQL.
Experience with Scrum methodology.
Experience with Mongo DB, Rabbit MQ.
Strong web technology skills and experience with testing web applications.Show more Report

Eitan Medical is a fast-growing global medical device company, developing and manufacturing innovative drug delivery and infusion solutions across the continuum of care – from the hospital to the home. We are looking for an excellent SW QA Engineer to join the R&D team.
Job Description:As a software testing Engineer you will be responsible for designing, planning and execution of test scenarios.Responsibility for finding defects and failures during system development and verification by manual and automatic testingInterface with the project's development teams to deliver a high quality product to be used on people.
Direct Manager: SW QA Team Leader
Requirements:

Education:
o QA course and / or ISTQB certification or a scientific degree - advantageJob skills:
o 1-2 years of experience in writing and running manual tests
o Experience in converting software requirement specification documents into testing documents.
o Experience in writing Software Test Plan - an advantage
o Knowledge in automation testing – an advantage
o Past experience in a medical device company – big advantage
Computer skills:
o Knowledge of all major Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint);
o SQL DB – writing and running queries (Join Level)
Language skills:
o Fluent English - writing and verbal.
Personality: Highly motivated, able to work under pressure and meet aggressive schedulesShow more Report

Vulcan Cyber helps cybersecurity teams stay on top of their game with end-to-end cyber risk management. Some of the world’s biggest companies turn to Vulcan to go beyond scanning data and actually mitigate cyber risk.
Every day, we work to become the essential tool for cybersecurity teams worldwide. We're looking for people who can make us better, keep us on our toes and help us transform the industry for good.
Right now, we’re looking for a Manual QA Engineer to join our team in TLV.
If you're a Vulcan, you have big ideas, live for the challenge, and love what you do and the people you do it with. You know that the best perk isn't the free food, the dog(s) in the office, or the remote working policy (don't worry, we have those too). It's the feeling that you're an integral part of building something great.
Feeling the vibe? Keep reading.
We are seeking a skilled Manual QA Engineer to join our team and help us improve the quality and efficiency of our releases. The main goals of this position are to identify and troubleshoot bugs, and to ensure that our products meet the needs and expectations of our customers. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of testing methodologies, the ability to analyze and translate business requirements into effective test cases, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced agile environment.
What you'll do:
Analyze and translate business requirements and user stories into test cases, testing suites, and testing scripts.
Troubleshoot customer scenarios and reproduce them in-house.
Design and implement tests, debugging, and review system requirements.
Act as a quality gate for releases.
What you have:
At least 3 years of experience testing complex web applications.
Deep understanding of various testing methodologies.
Strong analytical and technical skills.
Working experience in a high-paced agile environment.
What we'd love to see:
Experience with testing tools such as Postman and Cypress.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Cybersecurity experience.Show more Report

We are looking for a talented Software Quality Engineer to lead our rapid agile plans and join the growing R&D team which builds our LoadRunner Cloud products suite. Responsibilities: Take full testing ownership and lead the quality of OneAnalysis Product Write automated tests over existing automation framework as well as contributing to extend the frameworks according to product needs File defects with appropriate supporting information for development to investigate and prepare a fix Work with Developers during the entire product lifecycle, Participate in the Agile/SCRUM process Cooperate with UX, UI and functional architect for specifications, user interaction and graphic design Work according to high execution standards, while adhering to project goals and ensuring high quality Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (or equivalent) Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership which drives you to find ways to do things better, faster, and more efficiently Good understanding of the Agile software development lifecycle Solid English communication capabilities (verbal and written) Demonstrate strong knowledge with test strategies, test design and test types Experience with UI testing, and preferably with framework development Experience with JavaScript, TypeScript Experience with Protractor - big advantage Experience in test automation – Prefer, at least 2 years of experience Experience in manual testing – Must, at least 2 years of experienceShow more Report

About Splitit
Our mission is to help consumers responsibly enrich their lives by leveraging the credit they’ve already earned in a new and impactful way. Today consumers want control of how they pay for the things they want and need. Splitit is the only Installments-as-a-Service solution that enables consumers to use their existing credit to break payments into smaller, bite-sized pieces to pay over-time with no interest, applications or fees. That keeps money in the hands of shoppers to use as they want. By helping shoppers pay small we help businesses grow big. That’s a win-win. Splitit operates globally, with teams distributed around the world with offices in Atlanta (HQ) , Melbourne, and Tel Aviv.
Splitit is looking for an experienced QA Engineer that lives and breathes technology to help us achieve the best quality through manual testing and monitoring. You will be a part of the QA team who are responsible for Splitit’s product quality while executing at a fast pace. You will be part of the execution process, as well as responsible for improving it, and make business critical decisions.
This role requires excellent communication skills, as well as deep technical knowledge. Ultimately, you will ensure that our products, applications, and teams work flawlessly.
Responsibilities include:
Maintain and improve the quality driven execution of the organization, including its processes and procedures.Drive the company's quality strategy with the evolution of the company and its highly technical product.Help in driving the culture of quality, helping teams to be more independent and efficient in delivering with high quality.

Professional Requirements:
2+ years of experience as a QA Engineer.Experience in project management and QA methodology.Knowledge in testing methodology, product lifecycle.Experience working with web apps.Experience in Functionality, usability, performance, Sanity and regression tests.Experience in writing and executing SQL queries.Familiarity with Postman and API tests.Ability to work and make decisions under pressure.

Personal Requirements:
Highly organized and accurate, good eye for detailResponsible and dedicatedA team player with excellent interpersonal relationship skillsAble to work independentlyExcellent English skillsReport

The Role / Responsibilities:

Nayax is looking for a QA Engineer to join the Embedded group. You'll work in a fascinating and diverse multi-disciplinary environment, utilize your testing skills together with your passion for technology and help create an exciting and unique product released in high quality.
You should apply if you are a communicative, analytical, problem solver, tech savvy, who doesn't fear a challenge. We offer a great working environment in a successful company and development opportunities going forward.
The QA Engineer will report to Embedded Software QA Team Leader.
IN THIS POSITION YOU WILL:
Plan, conduct, and monitor manual testing and inspection of features and physical products.
Write test plans.
Investigate customer complaints.
Collect and compile statistical quality data.
Analyze data to identify areas for improvement.
Prepare reports to communicate outcomes of quality activities.

0-1 year of experience as a Manual QA Engineer.
Knowledge in STD, STP, STR documentation.
Knowledge of tools, concepts, and methodologies of QA.

Attention to detail.
Good analytical and troubleshooting skills.
A good team player – a must.

Product or industry-specific experience (payment/embedded)
Knowledge with SQL
Knowledge with Jira
Experience with Python for automated scripts

You will have the opportunity to work in a multinational environment for a global market leader.
Interested in automation? In the near future we plan on becoming fully automated.

Who we are:

Nayax is a leading global end-to-end retail technology platform for unattended & attended commerce. Our mission is to simplify commerce and payments for retailers while driving growth, optimizing operations, and enhancing consumer engagement.
Nayax Israel is located in the prestigious Herzliya Hills, just a short drive north of Tel Aviv or a very short walk from the train station.
Our open space offices accommodate our 400+ employees and when we’re not hard at work, you can find us enjoying an afternoon coffee on the balcony. We’re the largest Nayax site, housing over 20 different departments.
